t: Proverbs 17
Better*p is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
A*p wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
The*p fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the Lord*s trieth the hearts.
A*p wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
Whoso*p mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
Children's*p children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.
Excellent*p speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.
A*p gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
He*p that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
A*p reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.
An*p evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
Let*p a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
Whoso*p rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
The*p beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.
He*p that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the Lord.*s
Wherefore*p is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?
A*p friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
A*p man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
He*p loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
He*p that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
He*p that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.
A*p merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
A*p wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
Wisdom*p is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
A*p foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.
Also*p to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.
He*p that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
Even*p a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
